abstract: John M Blum, an influential historian of the American presidency whose 1954 biography of a maligned Theodore Roosevelt was pivotal in establishing the 26th president’s reputation as one of the country’s great chief executives, dies at age 90.
snippet: Professor Blum’s 1954 biography of a maligned Theodore Roosevelt was pivotal in establishing the 26th president’s reputation as one of the country’s great chief executives.
lead_paragraph: Professor Blum’s 1954 biography of a maligned Theodore Roosevelt was pivotal in establishing the 26th president’s reputation as one of the country’s great chief executives.

headline.main: John M. Blum, Historian of Presidents, Dies at 90
headline.print_headline: John M. Blum, Historian of Presidents, Is Dead at 90
headline.seo: John M. Blum, 90, Historian Who Gave Theodore Roosevelt His Due, Dies
